meanings.definition: Providing no hope; beyond optimism or hope; desperate.
meanings.sent1: The situation seemed hopeless as there was no chance of success.
meanings.sent2: She felt hopeless when she realized she had missed the last train home.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to catch the laser pointer was hopeless but entertaining.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to fix the broken vase was as hopeless as trying to hold water in a sieve.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathered, casting a hopeless shadow over the town.

meanings.definition: Feeling or causing despair about something.
meanings.sent1: He had a hopeless feeling in his chest as he watched the flames engulf the building.
meanings.sent2: The news of the accident left her feeling hopeless about the safety of the road.
meanings.sent3: The hopeless expression on the puppy's face made everyone in the room smile.
meanings.sent4: The endless traffic jam was a hopeless reminder of the city's congestion issues.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house stood in a state of hopeless disrepair, a symbol of neglect.

meanings.definition: Unable to be helped or improved.
meanings.sent1: The old, rusty car was in a hopeless state and beyond repair.
meanings.sent2: She knew the situation was hopeless when even the experts couldn't find a solution.
meanings.sent3: The hopeless plant perked up after receiving some much-needed sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The hopeless case of the missing keys turned out to be a simple case of forgetfulness.
meanings.sent5: The hopeless maze seemed to taunt the lost travelers with its unending paths.
